medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp, right lower quadrant abdominal pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began 2 months ago in the right lower quadrant (RLQ) and sometimes radiated to the left lower quadrant (LLQ). It was intermittent in nature, coming in waves lasting unspecified hours and then abating for unspecified hours. The pain occurred for about a week at a time, followed by periods without pain lasting unspecified days. The most recent episode started 5 days ago, was of unspecified intensity, and was similar to previous episodes. Associated symptoms included nausea and one episode of non-bilious non-bloody emesis 2 days prior to presentation. The patient has been able to eat and drink, passing flatus and having normal bowel movements; he denies fevers, chills, or changes in bowel or bladder habits.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD, treated with omeprazole; previous ankle repair.
medical_history.family_history: Father with coronary artery disease (CAD); mother healthy; maternal aunt with breast cancer; no family history of colon cancer, Crohn's disease, or ulcerative colitis.
